text: That's back when shows were good. These shows these days are just #$%$!  Just too serious. I grew up watching Good Times, Different Strokes, Mama's Family and the Jefferson's. Those were good shows. T.V. has went nothing but downhill every since.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Alfonso Ribeiro sounds off on a possible 'Fresh Prince' reboot
context_meta.summary: As "America's Funniest Home Videos" host Alfonso Ribeiro gears up for the premiere of show's 28th season tonight, the former "Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" star is shutting down any hopes for a possible reboot of his popular sitcom. According to Ribiero, the reason is pretty simple: he lost interest in the project when James Avery, who played his character Carlton's father on the show, died in 2013. What happened to the cast of "Fresh Prince of Bel-Air'?

text: Hollyweird has lost all sense of originality. Everything is a sequel, prequel, or a reboot.

text: As a kid and later young man, I NEVER thought anything of watching "Amos and Andy" or "Sanford and Son"; they were just great programs that brought a smile to my face and joy to my heart. I never thought a black was any different that a white, or a yellow, or a red...... you get the picture. HOWEVER, as we developed to a smarter race of people, all of a sudden everyone was telling us how we hated, or should hate each other, and life got so screwed up. I just want to be left alone with my happy thoughts of when you liked someone because they were nice, and you disliked them if they were mean. I'm 70 years old and glad to be leaving a planet that looks for reasons to hate. We gotta stop thinking of what we are saying or doing wrong and just think in terms of "hey like that guy, or gee what a nice lady she is." MAY THE LORD BLESS US ALL, AFTER ALL, HE MADE US ALL.

text: Fundamental ideas/approaches to managing an economy - Spend less money than you make. Save money when you can. Try not to borrow more than you can pay back. These are NOT "new" ideas. China remembers these fundamentals. Other economies dress things up under ridiculous labels (like "derivatives", "deficit spending", and "quantitative easing") and forget the basics. context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: China Sept FX reserves rise for 8th straight month in boost to President Xi
context_meta.summary: China's foreign exchange reserves rose modestly in September for an eighth straight month, and by slightly more than markets had expected, as tighter regulations and a stronger yuan continued to discourage capital outflows. A dramatic slowdown in capital flight - which had been seen as one of the biggest risks to China - has helped boost confidence in the world's second-largest economy ahead of a key Communist Party meeting this month, at which President Xi Jinping is expected to consolidate his grip on power. Forex reserves rose $17 billion in September to $3.109 trillion, compared with an increase of $10.5 billion in August, central bank data showed on Monday.

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: China Sept FX reserves rise for 8th straight month in boost to President Xi
context_meta.summary: China's foreign exchange reserves rose modestly in September for an eighth straight month, and by slightly more than markets had expected, as tighter regulations and a stronger yuan continued to discourage capital outflows. A dramatic slowdown in capital flight - which had been seen as one of the biggest risks to China - has helped boost confidence in the world's second-largest economy ahead of a key Communist Party meeting this month, at which President Xi Jinping is expected to consolidate his grip on power. Forex reserves rose $17 billion in September to $3.109 trillion, compared with an increase of $10.5 billion in August, central bank data showed on Monday.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: How Trump is planning to gut Obamacare by executive order
context_meta.summary: With a repeal bill off the table, the Trump administration has drafted an executive order that could blow a huge hole in the Affordable Care Act, according to a source with direct knowledge of the plan. The order would, in effect, exempt many association health plans, groups of small businesses that pool together to buy health insurance, from core Obamacare requirements like the coverage of certain essential health benefits. It would potentially allow individuals to join these plans too, which would put individual insurance marketplaces in serious peril by drawing younger and healthier people away from them. Together, these changes represent a serious threat to Obamacare: President Trump seems ready to open more loopholes for more people to buy insurance outside the health care law's markets, which experts anticipate would destabilize the market for customers who are left behind with higher premiums and fewer insurers.

context_meta.author: ipostwhaticareabout
context_meta.title: Tesla delays big rig truck after Musk blames 'production hell”
context_meta.summary: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk on Friday pushed back the unveiling of the company's big rig truck until mid-November, tweeting that the electric vehicle maker was diverting resources to fix production bottlenecks of its new Model 3 sedan and to help Puerto Rico. Musk said Tesla's Model 3 was “deep in production hell” echoing his own comments in July, when he showed off some of the first cars of that model. The Model 3 could help Tesla approach its goal of becoming more of a mass market producer. Recent comments have tempered expectations about the speed of the increase in production, though. Musk's comments came after the close of stock trading on Friday. The company's shares fell 0.8 percent

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Chicago breweries Hailstorm and On Tour score gold at Great American Beer Fest
context_meta.summary: An impressive day for Chicago breweries at the Great American Beer Festival included two particularly impressive wins. Tinley Park's Hailstorm Brewing scored a gold medal in the single most competitive category in the festival's history, while On Tour Brewing, launched earlier this year in West Town, won Very Small Brewing Company of the year. The awards were announced Saturday during the GABF in Denver. Hailstorm's Prairie Madness IPA beat out 407 other beers to win the American-style IPA category. It's a year-round staple of the brewery, and its win stunned head brewer and brewery co-founder Brandon Branbury. “It's a huge category and one that you'd never enter expecting to win,” he said. Branbury

context_meta.title: Ryanair's operations chief to step down after cancellation meltdown
context_meta.summary: LONDON (AP) — The chief operations officer of Ryanair has announced plans to leave his post at the end of October amid a cancellation spree affecting thousands of the company's flights. Company officials said Saturday that Michael Hickey will still have an "advisory role" after he steps down following decades with the airline. He is the first senior executive to leave because of the damaging flight cancellations, which have disrupted travel plans for an estimated 700,000 passengers and undercut the company's bid to improves its customer service reputation. context_meta.title: I Married the Same Man Twice
context_meta.summary: On April 5, 2008, I married the man of my dreams, or so I thought. At the time, I expected nothing but peaches and cream from marriage. Well, I quickly found out in that first year that marriage was more like trying to walk a tightrope with no wire: pretty much impossible to complete or balance. Every little thing became so big and irritating to me. It's so important to establish a friendship before a relationship to really know your partner, but there are still no guarantees. I felt like I knew everything I had to know about him, but what I failed to accept was his individuality. At the end of the day, he wasn't me and he'd never be. context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: IBM shifts center of gravity half a world away, to India
context_meta.summary: BANGALORE, India — IBM dominated the early decades of computing with inventions such as the mainframe and the diskette. Its offices and factories, stretching from upstate New York to Silicon Valley, were hubs of U.S. innovation long before Microsoft or Google came along. But over the past decade, IBM has shifted its center of gravity halfway around the world to India, making it a high-tech example of the globalization trends that the Trump administration has railed against. The company employs 130,000 people in India — about one-third of its total workforce, and more than in any other country. context_meta.title: 3 ways Obamacare changed birth control
context_meta.summary: The number of women with out-of-pocket expenditures on contraceptives has dropped from 21% pre-Obamacare to 3%, according to the most recently available data. "For many women with coverage who faced out of pocket costs -- which could be in the range of a $1,000 upfront -- not having to pay that has made it more affordable," Usha Ranji, associate director for women's health policy at the Kaiser Family Foundation, told CNN. Oral contraceptives are the most popular but more expensive contraceptives, like IUDs, have seen more substantial declines in cost.
